thread.title: Live updates: Auburn's Lashlee, Muschamp talk bye week, Kentucky
thread.title_full: Live updates: Auburn's Lashlee, Muschamp talk bye week, Kentucky | AL.com

author: Wesley Sinor | wsinor@al.com
title: Live updates: Auburn's Lashlee, Muschamp talk bye week, Kentucky
text:
Auburn offensive coordinator Rhett Lashlee and defensive coordinator Will Muschamp will meet with the media following Sunday's practice to discuss the bye week and the team's plans for the trip to Kentucky.
We'll provide live updates in the space below, so refresh this page regularly for the latest information.
MUSCHAMP
-- "I thought we had a good day today... Guy's worked hard."
-- "Kentucky has a good football team." Says QB Patrick Towles is playing at a "good level." Praises Kentucky's vertical ball, receivers and running backs.
-- Muschamp says "it'd be great" to get some pass rush.
-- On winning one-on-one battles: "We haven't been able to do that."
-- "We have to create more negative plays in the early downs to generate better third down situations... It's a trickle-down effect from up front."
-- Kentucky's running backs "can take it the distance at any time." One-cut, north-south runners. "This offense fits those guys extremely well."
-- Muschamp says he's preparing freshman Jauntavius Johnson to play.
-- T.J. Davis is coming along "OK." Has to get his confidence level up. Been a quick recovery.
-- Tre' Williams and Tim Irvin are "fine" and ready to play.
-- Towles has a "good command on what they're doing and what they're asking him to do.
-- On playing on a Thursday: "I just try and maintain routine." Says he told the players yesterday was Monday, today is Tuesday, tomorrow is Wednesday.
-- Muschamp says there is no update on Carl Lawson's injury.
LASHLEE
Auburn offensive coordinator Rhett Lashlee: Oct. 11, 2015 Auburn offensive coordinator Rhett Lashlee talks with the media after practice Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015, in Auburn, Ala. (Julie Bennett/jbennett@al.com)
-- Lashlee says both Jeremy Johnson and Sean White are still competing at quarterback, taking first team reps. Doesn't know when a decision will be made.
-- Xavier Dampeer is "doing OK" after reportedly injuring his jaw during a bar fight. Lashlee doesn't know if he'll be able to play, but there are several options at center if he can't.
-- Sean White's mentality is good. Says competition at every position is healthy. Says White and Johnson are "good buddies."
-- Extra time to prepare for Kentucky has been good. "They give you a lot of multiple looks." Praises Stoops.
-- "We're 1-0 in October."
-- "We have to be a great team offense. We don't have a bunch of individuals who are just going to make it happen on their own... It may be a different guy in each game or a different guy quarter to quarter."
-- Receiver Tony Stevens is "going to get opportunities" with D'haquille Williams gone.
-- In terms of leadership, Lashlee says individuals should start emerging now that we've reached midseason.
-- Lashlee says the quarterback who wins the job will be the guy who "I believe in both of those guys. We haven't played very good... I haven't given up on them... All you can do is keep working."
-- Auburn hasn't "over-analyzed" Jeremy Johnson's struggles in games. "You have to have a thick skin and a short memory."
-- "Practice is practice. You have to start making plays on Saturdays."
